alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 5:51PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elbert, southeastern Anderson and Abbeville Counties through 615 PM EST... At 551 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Elberton, or near Nancy Hart State Park, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Elberton, Calhoun Falls, Due West, Lake Secession, Lowndesville, Lake Strom Thurmond, Russell State Park, Nancy Hart State Park and Middleton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for northeastern Georgia...and Upstate South Carolina.
